coded_answer.p: I have seen your musical show "Over the Rainbow" in London. I have beenwas very disappointed when I had readread your advertisement,. I was keen on your show, but I have not seen the same show, I have seen one which it looked likelooked like it, but not bewasn't it.

First of all, I have beenwas attracted by the actors - Danny Brooks and Tina Truelove - and not by the actors who playedperformed effectlyeffectively that evening. ThisThese actors appeared with fourty-fiveforty-five minutes laterlate referingreferringaccording to whichwhat is written onin your advertisement. This latelateness forbidprevented me from going to dinner in your restaurant because it was just closing!

For all thisthese reasons I do wish that I would not have beennot hadhad not gone seeto see that show, for which the tickets were not available. And as a conclusionin conclusion I want you to give me my money back, (I have stillstill have the advertisement if you want the proothproof of what I say). You have the choice, either you makedo what I want, or I attack you in justicethe courts.
"The old man and the sea" E.H.

When I have readread this book, I have beenwas fascinated by the willwillpower of the old fisherfisherman. This willwillpower is so amazing, he has all the elements against him. His boat is so small and poor, he is old, it is hot and he is alone without any chance of to meetmeeting someoneanyone who could help him.
But I don't think he would want to.
He doen'tdoesn't want help because he wants to prove to the little boy and himself that he is not really old, even if he has a big agelived many years.

I think thisthese are the reasons offor his willwillpower. Although the fish is eaten by the sharks, he is the winner, the winner of himself. He could have triumphtriumphed otheover the fish because of his knowledge of the sea but it is principally because he has known research in the deeperdepths of his mind.
To conclude I think the difficultsmost difficult situations allow us to discover ourselfourselves getting out of ourselfourselves.
